comment.author: 82862615@N00
comment._content:
William Lorimer (1861-1934)
Republican U.S. Congressman and Senator (1909 - 1912)

English born but groomed in the Chicago "Boss" politics system, Lorimer was eventually drummed out of the Senate on charges of corruption and election fraud. Somehow, that black mark on his reputation didn't keep him from running La Salle bank for five years.

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: William Lorimer (April 27, 1861 – September 13, 1934) was a United States Senator and Representative from the State of Illinois. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Lorimer_(politician)

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: pixeljones and Richard Arthur Norton: Thanks for the additional info. about Lorimer.  We'll include it next time we update.

comment.author: 74471476@N08
comment._content: This picture might have been taken as the Senate was determining Lorimer's fate.  His disputed election to the Senate was a matter of prolonged controversy, and helped prompt the ratification of the 17th Amendment, providing for he direct election of senators, in 1913.  Can the site of the picture be determined as being near the Capitol building?.  Susan Barsy

comment.author: 74471476@N08
comment._content: This photograph inspired me to write a brief sketch of the man: susanbarsy.com/2012/07/26/lorimer/

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
Susan Barsy,

Very interesting biographical sketch of Mr. Lorimer. The photo is dated May 15, 1911, which does appear to coincide with the time period during which the inquiry into the validity of his election was re-opened by the U.S. Senate. The investigation ultimately resulted in his expulsion from the Senate.  Unfortunately, we don't have more information on where this photograph was taken and the background is a bit hard to read. 

We will add more details to the record when we update.
